p: Chemical investigation of the aqueous extract afforded eight known compounds ( Figure 2), identified as chlorogenic acid ( 1) [ 16], 3,4-di- O-( E)-caffeoylquinic acid ( 2) [ 17], 3,5-di- O-( E)-caffeoylquinic acid ( 3) [ 16, 17, 18], 4,5-di- O-( E)-caffeoylquinic acid ( 4) [ 16, 17, 18], 3,5-di- O-( E)-caffeoylquinic acid methyl ester ( 5) [ 17], apigenin ( 6) [ 19], genkwanin ( 7) [ 17], and acacetin ( 8) [ 20]. The structures of the known compounds were identified by comparing their spectroscopic and spectrometric data with those previously reported or by comparison with authentic samples ( Tables S1 and S2, Supplementary Materials). Compounds 1â€“ 5 and 8 are reported for the first time in this species.
